name: Wall Handstand
how_to_perform:
1. Find a sturdy wall with enough space to kick up into a handstand.
2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart in front of the wall, about an arm's length away.
3. Place your hands shoulder-width apart on the ground and slowly start to lift your legs up towards the wall, keeping them straight.
4. As you lift your legs, focus on engaging your core muscles to support your body in the handstand position.
5. Once both legs are in contact with the wall, use your upper body strength to balance and hold yourself in a steady handstand position for 10-15 seconds.
6. Release slowly, keeping control throughout the movement.
short_summary: Wall handstands are an exercise that strengthens the abs, shoulders, and core muscles by maintaining balance on one's hands against a wall.
